conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on the system consisting of a small ball, a rope, a pillow, and a child.
Gravity acts on the system with total weight (m1 + m2)g.
Tension in the rope pulls the ball and supports the pillow and child.
Normal force from the guide rail is perpendicular and does not contribute directly to motion along the groove.
Force exerted by the pillow on the child is equal to the tension in the rope.
Resolve forces along the inclined guide rail where forces are balanced.
Component of gravity along the rail is (m1 + m2)g sin(alpha).
Tension in the rope T balances the motion along the rail: T = (m1 + m2)g sin(alpha).
Resolve forces perpendicular to the rail where normal force balances the perpendicular component of gravity.
Normal force from the rail is (m1 + m2)g cos(alpha).
Analyze the rope tension and the force exerted by the pillow on the child.
Force exerted by the pillow on the child is the vertical component of the tension: Fp = T cos(beta).
Calculate the ratio of T to Fp using T = (m1 + m2)g sin(alpha) and Fp = T cos(beta).
Substitute T into Fp: Fp = ((m1 + m2)g sin(alpha)) cos(beta).
The ratio of T to Fp is Ratio = 1/cos(beta).
Final answer: The ratio of the tension in the rope to the force exerted by the pillow on the child is 1/cos(beta).
